regulatoryUpdates.title: Data Localization Amendment
regulatoryUpdates.summary: New circular mandating enhanced data localization for payment system operators

xaiReasoning.trigger: Automated monitoring detected new RBI circular published on rbi.org.in
analysis: Circular mandates complete payment data localization within 24 hours
Previous circular allowed 7-day grace period - now reduced to 24 hours
Applies to all payment system operators licensed under PSS Act
Non-compliance penalty increased to Rs. 1 crore per violation
xaiReasoning.recommendation: Initiate Constitutional AI Debate to interpret implementation requirements

xaiReasoning.trigger: FAQ document published clarifying incident reporting thresholds
analysis: Initial notification within 6 hours can be preliminary
Detailed incident report required within 24 hours
xaiReasoning.recommendation: Update incident response procedures to match new template

reasoning: Analyzed RBI circular RBI/2025-26/142 dated 2026-01-03
Cross-referenced with previous data localization requirements
Identified key change: 24-hour localization mandate
Assessed business impact on cross-border transactions
Reviewed operational constraints of card network processing
Identified exception in 2019 RBI clarification for processing abroad
Analyzed impact of strict interpretation on transaction latency
Proposed alternative interpretation allowing processing with copy
phases.position: Balanced interpretation - processing abroad with local copy

reasoning: Weighed proposer and critic arguments
Consulted precedent from previous RBI enforcement actions
Considered practical implementation timeline
Synthesized balanced approach respecting both compliance and operations

outcome.requirement: Payment data mirroring within 24 hours with cross-border processing allowed

reasoning: Analyzed DPDP Act Section 6 consent requirements
Identified all personal data processing activities
Mapped consent requirements to data flows
Proposed comprehensive consent management
phases.position: Consent required for all personal data processing

reasoning: Reviewed Section 7 legitimate use exemptions
Identified fraud prevention as legitimate use
Cross-referenced RBI KYC mandate as legal requirement
Proposed exemption for regulatory compliance activities
phases.position: Exemptions needed for fraud prevention and KYC

reasoning: Balanced consent-first principle with operational needs
Created clear categorization: consent-based vs legitimate-use
Ensured audit trail for both categories
Aligned with MeitY guidance on DPDP implementation

outcome.requirement: Consent Manager for marketing; legitimate use for fraud/KYC

detectionMethod.validation: Verhoeff algorithm for Aadhaar checksum validation

detectionRationale: Pattern matched 12-digit sequence in ticket TKT-2026-4521
Verhoeff checksum validation confirmed valid Aadhaar structure
Context analysis: Customer message field - likely shared by customer
No encryption or masking detected in storage
severityRationale: UIDAI strictly prohibits plaintext Aadhaar storage
DPDP Act classifies as Sensitive Personal Data
Exposure enables identity theft and financial fraud
remediationRationale: Immediate masking required (show only last 4 digits)
Input validation needed to prevent Aadhaar capture
Customer education on not sharing Aadhaar in tickets
Audit log created for potential breach notification

detectionMethod.validation: Luhn algorithm checksum + BIN database verification

detectionRationale: Pattern matched 16-digit sequence in fallback_card_details field
Luhn checksum validation confirmed valid card number
BIN 453288 identified as HDFC Bank Visa card
Context: Debug logging captured full PAN during UPI fallback
severityRationale: Full PAN in logs is direct PCI DSS 3.4 violation
RBI card storage guidelines explicitly prohibit this
Logs are persistent and may be backed up
Debug logs often have broader access than production data
remediationRationale: Disable debug logging in production immediately
Truncate historical logs to first 6 + last 4 digits
Add PAN detection filter in logging pipeline
Alert QSA for self-disclosure if needed

actionRationale: UPI VPA exposure rated as MEDIUM severity
Auto-remediation approved for MEDIUM severity findings
Masking script tested in staging environment
No business impact identified during testing
verificationSteps: Deployed masking filter to payment-api-logger service
Verified new logs show masked VPA (user***@provider)
Historical logs sanitized with same masking pattern
Monitoring enabled for any masking failures

keyProvisions: Section 4: Grounds for processing personal data
Complete payment data storage in India
Cross-border processing allowed with local copy
Audit trail for all data flows

PCI_DSS.fullName: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard
keyRequirements: Req 3.4: Render PAN unreadable in storage

AADHAAR.description: 12-digit unique identification number issued by UIDAI

PAN_CARD.maskingRule: Show first and last 2 characters only

BANK_ACCOUNT.description: Bank account number (9-18 digits depending on bank)

UPI_VPA.description: Virtual Payment Address for UPI transactions
UPI_VPA.maskingRule: Show first 3 chars and provider only
